definition: to act with urgency/to buy time
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: A clerk has just delivered the token by a bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 站员以脚踏车递送路牌予司机员以争取时间。

sentences.english: Buy time by turning the question back to the interviewer.
sentences.chinese: 通过将问题丢回给面试官来争取时间。

sentences.english: He tried to Buy time by doing a lot of talking.
sentences.chinese: 他为了争取时间滔滔不绝地讲个没完。

sentences.english: Second, what the Europeans are still doing is providing liquidity to buy time.
sentences.chinese: 第二个，欧洲人仍在为争取时间而提供流动性。

sentences.english: He felt that Tsnombe was playing for time and would not abide by the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他认为冲伯正在争取时间，而不会遵守协定。

sentences.english: The important thing now is to waste no time in launching projects that should be launched.
sentences.chinese: 现在的问题是要注意争取时间，该上的要上。

sentences.english: The Iraqi regime has used diplomacy as a ploy to gain time and advantage.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克政权一直把外交作为争取时间和优势的策略。

sentences.english: Sounds like a guy looking back and marking time.
sentences.chinese: 这些挺起来就像一个人在回首往事争取时间一样。

sentences.english: Review stage, for the time is very important.
sentences.chinese: 复习阶段，争取时间很重要。

definition: to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to hold up/to hinder/to stall
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to make prompt decisions (idiom)
to retreat
to save from damage/to preserve/to maintain/to keep in good repair/(Tw) security guard
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
to prepare/to make adequate preparation
to screen/to shield/to cover/protection/cover/CL:面[mian4]
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
to save one's life/to survive
